articles.description: The nation's system for providing unemployment benefits to jobless workers has consistently produced inaccurate data and lower-than-appropriate payouts to some workers amid the Covid-19 pandemic, a government watchdog said Monday.
articles.content: WASHINGTON -- The nation's system for providing unemployment benefits to jobless workers has consistently produced inaccurate data and lower-than-appropriate payouts to some workers amid the Covid-19… [+1314 chars]

articles.author: Evan Ramstad, Star Tribune
articles.title: Small businesses that took PPP aid may now face a punishing tax bill - Chicago Tribune
articles.description: The IRS said businesses cannot deduct expenses such as payroll and rent that were paid for with money from the Paycheck Protection Program of the CARES Act.

articles.author: Daniel Oberhaus
articles.title: The Race To Crack Battery Recycling—Before It’s Too Late - WIRED
articles.description: Millions of EVs will soon hit the road, but the world isn’t ready for their old batteries. A crop of startups wants to crack this billion-dollar problem.
articles.content: Every day, millions of lithium-ion batteries roll off the line at Teslas Gigafactory in Sparks, Nevada. These cells, produced on site by Panasonic, are destined to be bundled together by the thousand… [+3600 chars]
